record.author: Blust
record.classification: Austronesian, Malayo-Polynesian, Central-Eastern Malayo-Polynesian, Eastern Malayo-Polynesian, Oceanic, Central-Eastern Oceanic, Remote Oceanic, Central Pacific, East Fijian-Polynesian, Polynesian, Nuclear, Samoic-Outlier, Samoan

record.annotation: literally "ebb like the tide", usage in oratory refers to living cycles (inhale/exhale, sleep/awake, life/death, etc.
polite word for dog, rarely used.
works as a verb "to be great" or "to augment" instead of an adjective.
more commonly used in colloquial speech to express "ugly" or "unseemly"
More accurately refers to "straightness" (in modern slang, "sa'o" can mean something like "right on!")
